sub_topic: Identifying the Lewis structure of a molecule
message_1: What is the Lewis structure of carbon dioxide (CO2)?
message_2:
The Lewis structure of carbon dioxide (CO2) consists of a central carbon (C) atom double bonded to two oxygen (O) atoms. The structure can be represented as:

O=C=O

Each oxygen atom has two lone pairs of electrons, while the carbon atom shares four electrons with the oxygen atoms through the double bonds.
